title:
15d11 - Shipbuilding, alteration,
repair, and maintenance.
text:
The building, alteration,
and/or repair of ships under Government contract is work performed upon “public
works” within the meaning of the Davis-Bacon Act. Wage determinations for
shipbuilding under the D-B Act are issued only if the location of contract
performance is known when bids are solicited. However, a Government contract
which calls for the construction, alteration, furnishing, or equipping of a
“naval vessel” (U.S. Navy and U.S. Coast Guard vessels) is subject to PCA. A
contract which calls for maintenance and/or cleaning, rather than alteration or
repair, of a ship or naval vessel is a service contract within the meaning of
the SCA. (See FOH 13b11 and 14c06.)
html: The building, alteration, and/or repair of ships under Government contract is work performed upon “public works” within the meaning of the Davis-Bacon Act. Wage determinations for shipbuilding under the D-B Act are issued only if the location of contract performance is known when bids are solicited. However, a Government contract which calls for the construction, alteration, furnishing, or equipping of a “naval vessel” (U.S. Navy and U.S. Coast Guard vessels) is subject to PCA. A contract which calls for maintenance and/or cleaning, rather than alteration or repair, of a ship or naval vessel is a service contract within the meaning of the SCA. (See FOH 13b11 and 14c06.)
